node.title: U.S. Veteran Gets OK to Revive Suit Against Cops for Beating, Calling Him 'Fake American'
node.description: A circuit court ruled in favor of Jorge Gomez, who alleges that two New Orleans police officers lied about their off-duty status before beating him in 2018.

node.title: US and Iran seek to break impasse at nuclear talks
node.description: Critical talks with Iran to prevent the collapse of a nuclear deal are to resume in Vienna after five months.

node.title: Music festivals in doubt: 'What are those kids going to do?'
node.description: The brakes could be on major summer festivals after the government revealed red lights for their regions in the new traffic light system. Audio

node.title: Adele Is No. 1 With a Huge Week, but Without a Million in Sales
node.description: “30” tops the Billboard album chart with the equivalent of 839,000 sales in the United States, leaving Taylor Swift’s “Reputation” as the last LP to cross the million mark.

node.title: Malnourished Seal Pup Put To Sleep After Being Hit With Boat Propeller
node.description: "Unfortunately not every rescue has a happy ending, but at least we were able to free her from her trauma and pain," the animal's rescuers said.

node.title: Iranians Say U.S. Could Return to Nuclear Talks If It Lifts Sanctions Against Them
node.description: The remaining signatories of the 2015 Iran nuclear deal met on Monday in Vienna to discuss reentering the agreement.

node.title: Denver Hasn't Seen Measurable Snow in 222 Days, This Hasn't Happened Since the 1880s
node.description: The warmer temperatures and lack of snow coincides with a La Niña weather event, which is returning to the U.S. for the second winter in a row.

node.title: Germarcus David Charged With Murdering Family in California Home, Infant Child Among Dead
node.description: David was arrested and charged for allegedly killing five family members, including his four children, all under 12.

node.title: NY Governor Candidate Who Wants to Defund Police Also Lives on US Army Base
node.description: Williams' spokesperson said he chose a home on the Army base "because it offered the best unit for his family's price point and criteria."

node.title: Australia's word of the the year is phonetically satisfying  — and very frustrating
node.description:
Word of the year season is getting political as two dictionaries, and the voting public, choose "strollout" as definitive of 2021, writes Tiger Webb.

Word of the year season gets political as two dictionaries, and the voting public, choose ‘strollout’ as definitive of 2021.

node.title: Artificial intelligence is making decisions that affect us and some of those choices aren't that smart
node.description: Artificial intelligence is making decisions about people's insurance claims, credit scores and more. ABC Top 5 academic Jathan Sadowski explains why that matters.

node.title: The Earth has more water than makes sense. The missing source may be the Sun
node.description: The origin of Earth's water is a mystery, but one source could be the Sun, a new study that analyses the chemistry of an asteroid suggests.

node.title: The two scenarios that can bring on new variants like Omicron
node.description: Every time someone gets infected with SARS-CoV-2, there is a chance the virus could generate a more fit variant, which could then spread to others. This is the basics of how the Omicron variant emerged. So does vaccination disrupt the process?

node.title: 'I decided God can't have it both ways':  Fiona remembers the first time she was told she was special
node.description: Disability advocates are warning the Morrison government's  Religious Discrimination Bill doesn't go far enough to protect the rights of vulnerable communities.

node.title: Red or orange? Cabinet to decide regions' traffic light settings
node.description: Cabinet will decide today which regions go into the most restrictive 'red' setting under the Covid-19 traffic light system and which enter the new system at orange.

node.title: Auckland kaumātua among first to get booster vaccine doses
node.description: A group of kaumātua in Auckland are among the first in the country to receive their booster shots this morning.

node.title: Lee Elder, Who Broke a Golf Color Barrier, Dies at 87
node.description: In his prime he played in a league for Black players, but in 1975, at 40, he became the first African- American to take part in the Masters tournament.

node.title: Portugal Soccer Club Could Be First Source of Omicron Community Spread Beyond South Africa
node.description: 13 members of the Belenenses SAD soccer club tested positive for the virus after one of its players visited the country.

node.title: Vaccine Named Merriam-Webster's 2021 Word of the Year, Insurrection Also Considered
node.description: Vaccine was chosen in part because of a 608 percent increase in the number of times the word was searched in 2020 and a 1,048 percent increase this year.

node.title: Pfizer CEO Says They've Started Developing New COVID Vaccine Amid Omicron Spread
node.description: Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla said his company could have a new vaccine available in less than 100 days, if necessary.

node.title: Biden Denies Lockdowns Are Coming Amid Concerns About Omicron Evading Vaccines
node.description: President Joe Biden said he plans to release a new strategy for fighting COVID-19 this winter on Thursday.

node.title: Roadmap for tourism recovery outlines potential challenges and costs
node.description: Tourism Industry Aotearoa chief executive Chris Roberts says the roadmap aimed to provide guidance so tourism businesses could plan for a range of potential pathways.

node.title: Chinese families 'have lost everything' says Solomons group
node.description: A group representing Chinese people in Solomon Islands says many Chinese families have lost everything and been left homeless following the widespread looting and torching of shops and properties.

node.title: Fauci on Omicron variant: "We should not be freaking out"
node.description: Dr. Anthony Fauci said it's going to take some time — perhaps a couple of weeks — to "get a good handle" on the newly discovered strain.

node.title: Kiki and Herb Will Be Back Where They Belong for Christmas
node.description: Justin Vivian Bond and Kenny Mellman have resurrected their Christmas act for “a big, old chosen family reunion.”

node.title: Donors Worry About Fate of Artifacts as Museum on Irish Famine Closes
node.description: Quinnipiac University, which had opened Ireland’s Great Hunger Museum in 2012, said that it could no longer afford to operate it.

node.title: Avoiding Cyber Monday, Giving Tuesday Online Scams
node.description: Some scammers have used advertisements for holiday-themed advent calendars to dupe shoppers, the Better Business Bureau warned.

node.title: Parents Fret Over 'Kool-Aid Man' TikTok Trend, Despite No Clues It's Real
node.description: Homeowners have reported teens damaging fences, citing it as the "Kool-Aid Man" TikTok challenge, but police told Newsweek it wasn't related to the app.

node.title: Covid-hit NZ Breakers asking for postponement of NBL season opener
node.description: The New Zealand Breakers are pushing for their NBL season opener next weekend to be postponed due to the Covid-19 cases within the team's wider group.

node.title: Epstein accuser speaks out ahead of Ghislaine Maxwell's trial
node.description: Jennifer Araoz, who says Jeffrey Epstein raped her when she was 15, was the first accuser to speak about her allegations against him on TV.
